question: Is Golden Key Driving School a ministry approved course provider?
answer: Yes, Golden Key Driving School is a Ministry-Approved Beginner Driver Education Course Provider.

question: What if I miss an in-class or in-car lesson?
answer: If you miss an in-class lesson, you'll have to make up for it. To see when that class is being taught again, please contact us! Typically, the lesson will be taught again when the course is running again. If you miss an in-car lesson, please contact your instructor 48 hours in advance to avoid a cancellation fee. Lessons in car can be made up by rescheduling with your driving instructor.

question: How do I schedule in-car Sessions?
answer: Make sure that you have completed your online course first. Once that's completed, please email us to schedule your in car-lessons.

question: How do I book my G2 road test?
answer: You can book your road test by visiting www.drivetest.ca or by going to an exam center in person.

question: Can I register for the BDE course without having a G1 license?
answer: Yes, you can register and complete the theoretical (in-class or online) portion of the course. However, in order to do any in-car lessons, you must obtain your G1 license first!

question: Will there be more than one student in the vehicle?
answer: No, all lessons are One-on-One with an instructor unless a special request is made by both students to be together. However, due to the current Covid19 restrictions, only one student is allowed in the vehicle at a time.

question: How do I get my certificate for my insurance?
answer: Once you complete your course, and we certify you to the Ministry of Transportation of Ontario, you will have to go to Service Ontario and request a 'Driver's License History Report'. The Driver's License History provides proof of successful completion of and graduation from a BDE course. BDE graduates with a DLH (Driver's License History) are eligible for an insurance discount.
